visualization_prompt: Generate a solid gauge dashboard showing time intervals until a target date using dynamic value updates with synthetic maximum ranges
visualization_explanation: This visualization uses a dual solid gauge design to represent synthetic time intervals with two distinct statistical properties: 1) A decreasing trend in days (μ=15, σ=5) following Poisson process assumptions for event countdowns, and 2) Cyclical hourly patterns (μ=18, σ=6) reflecting diurnal variation. The radial encoding adheres to Cairo's magnitude perception principles through arc-length proportional representation. Tufte's data-ink ratio is optimized by removing axis lines and using high-contrast semicircular tracks. Synthetic maxima (30 days/24 hours) maintain domain validity while allowing flexible temporal resolution. The dark pane background (80% opacity) with bright foreground colors achieves 3:1 contrast ratio for accessibility.
